string.text: The selected files have been removed
Only files ending in JPG, JPEG, GIF or PNG are valid filenames
Filenames must not contain quote characters
Please specify the name of any image file that should be used as album/film art if it is found to be within a media directory.

[em]Album/Film Art[/em] files are the names of image files that the SwissCenter should look for when it is displaying a browse function (Browse Videos, Browse Music by folder, etc) or when you have selected an album or film. [p] If any of the files you specify here are found within a directory, then the first one to be found will be displayed on the Swisscenter interface.
If Album Art is present within the ID3-Tag of a music file, then it will be extracted and stored in the database as the preferred art to use on the SwissCenter interface.

SwissCenter allows you to browse your media files in a number of different ways. To reduce the complexity of the interface or to customise it more to your liking you can disable any of the "Browse by..." options shown below. If only one option is enabled then SwissCenter will jump straight to that option instead of showing a menu. [p]Please note that you must leave at least [b]one[/b] option enabled in each group.
This option allows you to use SwissCenter to browse simple Web pages, both on your local network and on the Internet (providing you have Internet connectivity).
Please specify the directory in which the SwissCenter server should cache image files that have been resized (for example, the folder art for an album, or the thumbnail of a photograph)
Please enter a fully qualified directory path
The directory that you specified does not exist
The value you entered for the cache size is not a number
Please enter a cache size (or 0 for an unlimited cache)
The cache size you entered is too small
Enabling this option will cause SwissCenter to generate thumbnails for all images that it finds during a media search.

This is the maximum amount of disk space (in Megabytes) that will be used to cache the image files (a value of 0 indicates an unlimited cache). Once this limit has been reached, previously cached files will be deleted on a least recently used basis.
When enabled, SwissCenter will cache all style details in memory. Disable this feature if you are developing new styles and need to see changes reflected immediately.

Specifying a category helps you to sort your media files into logical groups such as "Audio Books" and "Language learning" as well as "General". For example, using this feature will allow you to play a random selection of music without a chapter from an audio book being added to the playlist.
The selected categories have been removed
This field determines if extra information should be downloaded from the internet for files assigned to this category when it is available.
Settings not saved, you must select at least one option in each group
This screen allows you to create and populate the SwissCenter database. The parameters that will be used to build the database are shown below.
Unable to access the database - are your [i]Database Config[/i] settings correct?

Unless you entered a value for the [em]root[/em] password during the installation of MySQL, then it is probably not set and you should leave this field blank.[p][em]Please Note: Creating the database can take several minutes to complete. Please be patient. [/em]
You may choose to enable or disable specific features that make use of an internet connection below. It is recommended that you leave all the features enabled.

There are a number of features within the SwissCenter interface that make use of an internet connection either to retrieve information (eg: Weather Forecasts) and or to periodically poll for information (eg: New Updates).
Unable to connect to MySQL using the Host, Username and Password specified
Connection to MySQL established, but unable to select the specified database

This is the format used to display dates and can be changed to your preferred format. The format is defined by MySQL and some format specifiers are:[br][ul] [li]%b Abbreviated month name (Jan..Dec) [/li] [li]%d Day of the month, numeric (00..31)[/li] [li]%m Month, numeric (00..12) [/li] [li]%Y Year, numeric, four digits[/li] [li]%y Year, numeric (two digits)[/li][/ul]
Unable to create database - Is your MySQL "Root" password correct?
Unable to create user - Is your MySQL "Root" password correct?

The [i]Logging Mode[/i] controls how much information will be written to the support.log file when using the SwissCenter. If you are reporting a bug that you are able to reproduce, please ensure that the Logging mode is set to the maximum before capturing the log.
Warning: You already have a SwissCenter database. [br]If you proceed, then all current information and settings will be lost.
Manual, Program, Apeture Priority, Shutter Priority, Program Creative, Program Action, Portrait, Landscape

Unknown, Daylight, Fluorescent, Tungsten (incandescent), Flash, Fine Weather, Cloudy Weather, Share, Daylight Fluorescent, Day White Fluorescent, Cool White Fluorescent, White Fluorescent, Standard Light A, Standard Light B, Standard Light C, D55, D65, D75, D50, ISO Studio Tungsten
Unknown, Average, Centre Weighted, Spot, Multi-Spot, Pattern, Partial
Normal, Flip Horizontal, Rotate 180, Flip Vertical, Transpose, Rotate Right, Transverse, Rotate Left

The controls on this page allow you to modify the internal workings of SwissCenter and should only be done by advanced users know what they are doing. For more details, see %s. [b]Use at your own risk[/b].

Clicking on the button below will save all of your configuration settings to an XML file which you can then use to reconfigure Swisscenter if it becomes necessary to reinstall or recreate your database.[p][b]Please note:[/b] This option does not save details about the audio, video or photos that have been discovered by Swisscenter. Nor does it save Movie information which has been downloaded from the internet or manually entered.

Any extra information such as synopsis, actors, etc can be exported to an XML sidecar file. This can then be used to re-import video details whenever a new database is created. The above option 'Use XML sidecar files' must first be 'Enabled'.
Export all extra information to XML
If you encounter a situation where you need to refresh all the video information that was downloaded from the internet, for what ever reason, then you may do so by clicking on the button below.
However, please be aware that if you have manually entered information using the %s page then this information will be lost.
Database is not fully patched. Last patch successfully applied was %s.
The .NET Framework version 2 is needs to be installed.
Only a small percentage (<50%) of your music has been analysed by MusicIP. Although MusicIP will be able to generate playlists you may find that they are not very accurate.
MusicIP is not installed (or configured correctly).
The default charset of your MySQL server is not 'latin1', this will cause encoding issues. Reconfigure your MySQL server with [i]character-set-server=latin1[/i], and recreate the database.

The default collation of your MySQL server is not 'latin1_swedish_ci', this will cause encoding issues. Reconfigure your MySQL server with [i]collation-server=latin1_swedish_ci[/i], and recreate the database.
Unable to connect to the MySQL server.
Unable to connect to the SwissCener database (Have you created one?)
Your version of MySQL is not supported. You must have at least version 5.0 of MySQL installed
You have no command line version of PHP installed. SwissCenter will be unable to search for new media files.
Not all recommended PHP modules are available. Some non-critical features have been disabled as a result (recommended modules are: [b]%s[/b]).
Unable to locate a TrueType font. The "Now Playing" screen will be missing track information.
... but the font seems to be invalid (or not available)
Not all PHP modules required by SwissCenter are available (required modules are: [b]%s[/b]).
Your version of PHP is not supported (%s). You must have at least version 5.2.6 of PHP installed.
Background jobs are unable to run - this may be because cron (linux) or the task scheduler service (windows) is disabled.
The SwissMonitor service is not installed.
The SwissMonitor service is installed, but is not currently running.
Unable to write to the SwissCenter cache directory (%s).
The following installation files are either missing or incorrect. Click each file to download, then manually copy to the correct location. %s
Unable to locate the 'swisscenter.ini' file. [br]Have you created a SwissCenter database yet?
No media locations have been defined.
Unable to write to the SwissCenter log file (%s).
Unable to write to the SwissCenter playlists directory (%s).
Unable to locate Wget. The media search will fail to run. Please specify the correct location in the %s section.
WARNING: A file with this name alreay exists. If you save now it will overwrite the existing file.

Flickr %s is an online photo management and sharing application. Its primary goals are to help people make photos available to those who matter to them, and to enable new ways of organizing pictures. You can join Flicker for free and begin sharing images immediately. [p]SwissCenter will allow you to view your photographs and those of your contacts.
View your Flickr photographs and those of your contacts.
No user with the supplied username (%s) was found.
Each SwissCenter user can be associated with a Flickr user. If you do not enter your Flickr username then you will not be able to view your contacts and photographs.

This option allows you to modify the maximum number of displayed characters in the SwissCenter menus. The value depends on the font used by the various player types, and should be in the range of [b]1.0[/b] to [b]2.2[/b]. The player types are grouped as follows: [ul][li]100 - ShowCenter 1000g, etc.[/li] [li]200 - ShowCenter 200/250HD, EVA700, etc.[/li] [li]400 - Popcorn Hour A-100/A-110/A-200, HDX 1000, etc.[/li][/ul]
Extension added. The service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
The selected extensions have been removed. The service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
Specify file extensions that will be ignored by SwissMonitor.

ImageMagick (available from %s) is used to improve performance when manipulating images. It is much faster at rotating and scaling images than PHP so will cause pages containing many images to load quicker.
Please enter a fully qualified directory path
Please specify the full path of the ImageMagick installation folder. This is usually detected on Windows systems but on Linux based systems you will have to manually enter this.

Most modern digital camera record whether the camera was in "Landscape" or "Portrait" mode when a photograph was taken. Enabling this option will cause SwissCenter to automatically rotate the photograph before displaying it on the screen.

By default SwissCenter will center landscape photos and crop them to match the aspect ratio of the TV. However, if you prefer the entire image to be displayed (with black bars at the top and bottom) then you should disable this option.
Please choose the method that the SwissCenter should use when generating images on the fly.
Enabling this option will cause SwissCenter to enlarge small images so that they fill the entire screen.
Transition effects available for slideshows. These effects may differ for different players, and some players may not support transitions at all.
Errors occurred whilst importing the supplied settings file.
To restore your configuration from an earlier point in time, please select your settings XML file below.
Failed to import media location '%s' because category '%s' does not exist.
Failed to import media location '%s' because certificate '%s' (Scheme:%s) does not exist.
Failed to import media location '%s' because media type '%s' does not exist.
Failed to import user '%s' because certificate '%s' (Scheme:%s) does not exist.
The following tests failed:when run in the background.

Connections to individual Internet Radio stations are made directly from the ShowCenter box when requested by the user. If your ShowCenter does not have direct access to the internet then you should disable this feature.

This specifies whether or not your PC has an internet connection that SwissCenter can use. If you set the value to 'Automatic' then SwissCenter will try to detect an internet connection automatically.
Connections to individual Internet TV stations can be made from SwissCenter when enabled.
SwissCenter can cache station information. But since the station list will continuously be changing, we should refresh them from time to time. One hour (3600s) is a good compromise.

Please specify a country that you would like to search for. Only %s supports searching by country so visit the site to lookup valid countries. When searching SHOUTcast we are actually searching for station titles containing the country.
Select the Country to search for:
The selected search parameters have been removed
You must specify a (numeric) value for 'Secs to keep stations'! If you want to turn this off, enter 0 (zero).
You must specify a (numeric) value for 'Max stations/genre'!
You must specify a [b][i]numeric, non-zero[/i][/b] value for 'Max stations/genre'!
Please specify a genre and sub-genre (optional) that you would like to search for. Both %s and %s support searching by genre so visit the sites to lookup valid genres
IceCast (%s) is an internet radio service similiar to SHOUTcast. It provides the functionality to search by genre and station name.

Live365 (%s) is a radio network that reaches millions of listeners worldwide, offering greater breadth and depth of high-quality streaming music, talk, and audio than any other network. Featuring 260+ genres of music produced by 5,000+ broadcasters and music tastemakers from over 150 countries, the network boasts a roster of artists and radio producers ranging from the Atlanta Symphony, Pat Metheny, David Navarro, and Carlos Santana, to commercial and public radio stations, to individual DJs who program stations in every musical style.

LiveRadio (%s) is an internet radio service similiar to SHOUTcast. It provides the functionality to search by media type, genre, station name, country and even city - but many stations listed here are not supported by some hardware players. So the LiveRadio parser used by SwissCenter restricts the results to show only MP3 stations.
Select the Main-Genre to search for:

Maximum number of radio stations to retrieve per genre. The more is [b]not[/b] the better: Putting this number to high will not only increase the time to retrieve them (and thus make a browser timeout more likely), but also the possibility of an "out-of-memory" error from PHP. A good number is 24. Reduce it, if you encounter one of the mentioned possible errors.
No stations could be found that match your search for '%s'
The internet radio servers (SHOUTcast, Live-Radio, etc.) allow searching for radio stations by station, genre, and country. Here you can define your favourite search criteria.

Listen to online radio, find streaming music radio and streaming talk radio with RadioTime. The best guide to every type of radio: conservative, progressive, public, news, sports, religious, jazz, classical, rock, country, business, latin, hip-hop, pop, adult contemporary, and more.

SHOUTcast (%s) is a radio service on the internet, providing audio streams playable by most streaming devices (and programs). It provides the functionality to search by genre or station name, and returns many details for each station found, including a playlist URL. The SHOUTcast parser used by SwissCenter parses the HTML of the result page, to display the result set in a way easy to read also on TV screens. However, it may break when the page structure will be changed by the SHOUTcast staff.[p]Sometimes SHOUTcast pretends to have no stations listed for our search. So if the test seems to fail, better load the page again - to ensure the problem is not located here.

Please specify a station name that you would like to search for. An image (optional) can also be specified which will be used on the Now Playing screen for this station. The image must be in your [em]"../images/iradio/"[/em] folder.
Select the Station to search for:
Select the Station to tune in:

Steamcast (%s) is a drop in replacement for both SHOUTcast or Icecast or both. Bringing both the versitility of Icecast and the popularity of SHOUTcast together into one small package. Steamcast uses the popular HTTP/ICY protocol to deliever media to your clients which means that just about any player can support it.
Select the Sub-Genre to search for:

Please specify the fully qualified path of your "iTunes Music Library.xml" file. This will be used to add/replace your iTunes playlists in SwissCenter.[p]For example: On Windows this might be [em]"C:\Documents and Settings\Robert\My Music\iTunes\iTunes Music Library.xml"[/em]
The file you specified must be "iTunes Music Library.xml"
Please enter the fully qualified path of your "iTunes Music Library.xml"
The selected texts have been removed
You did not select any texts to delete
Please enter both Native Name and ISO Code to add language

Use this to add support for a new language. Enter the native language name, ie. Español (not Spanish), and it's corresponding %s code (es). You can also add localised languages such as en-us for English (US). This is formed by the ISO 639-1 code (en) and the %s region subtag (us).

Last.fm is the world's largest social music platform with over 20 million active users based in more than 232 countries. Using a unique music recommendation system known as "Audioscrobbler", Last.fm builds a detailed profile of each user's musical taste by recording details of all the songs the user listens to, either on the streamed radio stations or on the user's computer or portable music device. [p] Users can create custom radio stations and playlists from any of the audio tracks in Last.fm's music library, but are not able to listen to individual tracks on demand, or to download tracks unless the rightsholder has previously authorised it. Registration is required to acquire a profile but is not necessary to view any part of the site or to listen to radio stations.
When enabled, SwissCenter can connect to the Last.fm website and access personalised radio streams.
Play music similar to an artist or group
Play music with a specific tag

Please specify the fully qualified directory path where the media can be found. Eg: On Windows this might be [em]"C:\Documents and Settings\Robert\My Documents\My Music"[/em] or on a Linux system it might be [em]"/home/Robert/Music"[/em]
Parsers failed to lookup any details.
Parsers successfully downloaded and stored details.
Please enter a maximum size for any playlists that are generated. The absolute maximum allowed is 2000 due to player limitations. A sensible maximum is around 200.
The selected directories have been removed
Please select the default certificate for unrated media
The directory you specified does not exist
Please enter a fully qualified directory path
Type, Category, Certificate, Directory, Network Share
You did not select any locations to delete

Clicking the button below will begin a background scan of all your media locations. Media that is no longer present on your system will be removed from the database and any new or changed media will be added.
Please select the type of media that this location should be searched for.
There are no messages to display
Please select a message to view

MusicIP (available free from %s) is a great piece of software which analyses your music collection and generates an "acoustic fingerprint" of each song. This information is then used to generate a personal playlist of similar tracks based on a selected track, artist or album. [p]If MusicIP is installed on the same machine as SwissCenter, then extra features become available to generate and listen to MusicIP playlists directly from within the SwissCenter interface.
MusicIP server not found on port %s
Moods are playlists containing songs to be used as seeds to generate the mix. The Moods playlists must be saved in the 'moods' subfolder of your MusicIP Mixer installation.
A MusicIP server cannot be found.

Enter the port number that the MusicIP server is listening on. If you have not changed anything then the default port will be 10002. [p][b]Note:[/b] MusicIP must be installed on the same server as SwissCenter.
Recipes are a set of constraints and rules that are applied when generating the mix. Recipes are defined in recipes.xml in your MusicIP Mixer installation folder.
You can prevent the same artist being played twice within a set time period (or number of tracks) using this option.
The number of tracks that MusicIP should return as part of a playlist.

This setting allows you to specify how closely the style of the artists within the mix will match the seed song. A high number will probably result in only a few different artists being chosen, while a small number will allow more variation in style.
Allows you to specify how much variety you like to have in your mix. The higher the setting, the more variety will be introduced into the mix.
The font width multiplier is not a number
The font width multiplier is too small
Please use the Configuration Utility to create a database.
You have not created a database.
Please use the Configuration Utility to create a configuration file.
Your SwissCenter configuration file is missing.
Please use the Configuration Utility to add some media locations.
You have no media locations defined.
The directory where you have installed SwissCenter is not readable/writeable by the webserver user.
The windows "Task Scheduler" service is require by SwissCenter to enable searching for media files.
The "Setup.sql" file in the SwissCenter directory is missing.
The %s module is not loaded - you may need to recompile PHP with the relevant option selected.
The %s module is not loaded - please modify your php.ini file to enable it.
Please enter the details that you would like to [em]add[/em] to each of the videos listed above [br] (holding down the CTRL key will allow you to select multiple entries in the lists)
You did not select any videos to update

When new video items are discovered during a "new media search", the SwissCenter will use the filename of the video file to search for and download additional video information (eg: Actors, Directors, etc) from the site you specify below.
All extra video information is being exported to XML
All extra video information scheduled for refresh
You may enter new Actors, Directors or Genres that are not listed into the boxes below. [br] To add more than one new entry, separate each entry with a comma.
The following videos will be updated
Could not detect any network shares. If you have a NMT player then it must be switched on.

The network share is only required if you have DVD images (iso, img, etc) in this media location, and can only be used with a NMT media player. To play DVD images you must first setup a SMB or NFS network share on your NMT to allow access to your DVD images, then associate the network share with this media location.

A daily check is made for important messages regarding the SwissCenter interface. If new messages are available then an icon will appear on the main menu to indicate that they are available for you to view.

Select the source of the fanart images to be used on the enhanced 'Now Playing' screen. Fanart images are stored for each artist in [em]swisscenter\fanart\artists\depeche mode[/em].[br][b]None[/b] - no fanart will be downloaded. Only existing images in your fanart folder will be used.[br][b]Google Images[/b] - fanart will be searched for at Google Images and downloaded locally to your fanart folder..[br][b]Last.fm[/b] (recommended) - artist images will be downloaded to your fanart folder from Last.fm.
This is the minimum width and height of fanart downloaded from Last.fm. Increasing this setting will result in lower quality images not being used.

Some hardware players allow a picture to be displayed whilst a music track is played - and they request it automatically on title change. SwissCenter uses this feature to display details on the current track.[p]In most cases, SwissCenter is able to automatically decide if your player supports this, but if you experience problems then it is possible to override the setting here.[p]So the settings mean: Enabled - the player requests the corresponding picture automatically. Disabled - the player does not request automatically, and SwissCenter tells it by the playlist to request a new one in a given time interval. Automatic - let SwissCenter find out.

The original 'Now Playing' screen displays track details with an albumart image which updates with track changes. The enhanced option shows track details with a progress bar and a fanart image as background. This option is recommended for NMT users. In the NMT setup you should set 'Photo Transition' to 'None'.
There are no items to display
You do not have a playlist defined at the moment.

OpenSubtitles.org provides a free database of subtitles available for download. Subtitles are available in many languages and are uniquely matched to your video files. Please click their banners and visit their website to support this feature.

OpenSubtitles.org provides a free database of subtitles available for download. Subtitles are available in many languages and are uniquely matched to your video files. Please visit their website by clicking their banner to support this feature.[br]If you have subtitles that are not available for download then you are encouraged to upload them so that other users can benefit from them. You can upload subtitles at %s.
OpenSubtitles.org is currently not available. Please try again later.
These are the various options that can be set which affect results returned by the individual parsers.
IceCast parser seems to work properly
Live365 parser seems to work properly
LiveRadio parser seems to work properly
More than 50% of your music has been analysed by MusicIP
Successfully connected to the MySQL server.
Successfully connected to the SwissCenter database.
Your version of MySQL is supported.
A command line version of PHP has been detected.
All suggested PHP modules are available.
Successfully located a TrueType Font for generating "Now Playing" images.
All required PHP modules are available.
Your version of PHP is supported.
RadioTime parser seems to work properly
Automatic searching for new media is supported.
SHOUTcast parser seems to work properly
Steamcast parser seems to work properly
Able to Read/Write to the SwissCenter cache directory.
Able to Read/Write to the SwissCenter playlists directory.
Installation was as a user other than root.
Able to Read/Write to the SwissCenter installation directory.
This is the resolution that SwissCenter will use when being used through a web browser on a PC.
You must have at least version 4.3.9 of PHP installed
Your PHP version is too old.
Your PIN number has been changed
Please enter your PIN using the number buttons on your remote control
The PIN numbers did not match, not changed
The selected players have been removed
Please enter a name, make, and model
Please enter a numeric model number

All media players can be uniquely identified by their make and model determined from the firmware id. If your media player is not listed with the supported players below then you should add it with the make and model detected in the 'Clients discovered' section at the bottom of this page.[p] It is important that you select the correct chipset for your player as this will tell SwissCenter what the player is capable of. The POD values are used to tell the player how the 'Now Playing' screens are synchronised. You will have to experiment with these to determine which work best with your player.[p] If any details are added/changed on this page then you are requested to submit the details to the forum so that your compatibility settings can be used by other users.

These are the POD (Picture On Demand) parameters sent to the hardware player that controls how music and images will be sync'd together on the "Now Playing" screens. If the player is not capable of sync'd music and images then select 0 for 'POD (Original)'.

If your media player is not listed above then it should be added using the make and model id listed below. The correct chipset should be selected for the player as this will allow SwissCenter to determine it's capabilities.
Does this hardware device support resume of media (when using Simese)?
The transition effect to use between "Now Playing" screens. Setting to 0 usually means no effect.

Please specify the fully qualified directory where playlists should be stored by the SwissCenter. [p]For example: On Windows this might be [em]"C:\Documents and Settings\Robert\My Documents\My Playlists"[/em] or on a LINUX system it might be [em]"/home/Robert/Playlists"[/em]
The directory you specified does not exist
Please enter a fully qualified directory path
Please enter a valid maximum playlist size (between 10 and 2000)
Select a playlist to be automatically loaded at startup. This is useful if you find yourself always having to select the same playlist for background music before viewing photos.
Playlist loaded %s tracks, %s were not found in the database.
Please enter the name you would like to use for your playlist

[b]Unsolicited Email/Messages[/b] [p][ul][li]We will never send you unsolicited email.[li]Messages downloaded to the SwissCenter interface will relate only to the capabilities and operation of the interface. If you wish you may prevent even these messages from being downloaded by disabling the "Messages" feature in the "Connectivity" section.[/ul]

[b]Data Collection[/b] [p]Information relating to the media files on your machine is collected and stored in a MySQL database located on the PC on which the SwissCenter software is installed. This information is used for the sole purpose of providing you with an interface to your media files on such devices as the Pinnacle Showcenter. At no point is this of any other information transmitted in any form to the authors of the SwissCenter, or to any other third party. [p]There is one exception to the above statemnet :- To obtain extra information regarding video files (such as actors, directors, etc) the filename is submitted as part of a search query to the website selected on the %s screen. If you would prefer that this information is not transmitted then you should disable the "Video Info Download".
The number of days in the past that media added to SwissCenter will be shown in the 'Recent Media' on your media player.

Select the date to be used to determine which media is recent:[br][ul][li]Recently added: If it has recently been added to the media library.[/li][li]Recently created: If it has recently been created on the system.[/li][li]Recently added or created: If is was either recently added to the media library or recently created on the system.[/li][/ul]

Selecting database cleanup will remove any orphaned records from the database such as media no longer in a media location and actors/directors no longer referenced. This will increase the time taken for the media search and should be used when media has been removed.
SwissCenter is searching for new or updated media and adding it to the database. This may take a few moments, so please be patient.
Select this option to include scanning your iTunes library for playlists with this Media Search.
Select this option to force all media metadata to be refreshed. This should only be used after a SwissCenter update that introduces new metadata functionality.

The database refresh has been started in the background and you may continue to use the system as normal. However please be aware that not all media files will be available for playback until the refresh is complete. [p]The initial refresh can take approximately 10 minutes for every 5,000 media files present on your system. However subsequent refreshes are much faster.
Remote access to the [em]SwissCenter Configuration Utility[/em] is disabled for security reasons.
Select the function button to change:
You should install the SwissCenter software as the webserver user - "root" installs are not supported.
Specify the number of items that this feed should cache. When this limit is met then older items will be deleted. Specify '0' to keep all items.
The selected RSS feeds have been removed
Please enter the number of items to cache for the RSS feed
Please enter a title for the RSS feed
Please select the type of the RSS feed
Please enter a URL for the RSS feed
This option allows you to use SwissCenter to view RSS feeds, including audio and video podcasts.
SwissCenter is now updating your RSS feed(s). This may take a few minutes, so please be patient.

A search for new media will be performed at the given time for each of the days specified below. It is recommended that you search for new media daily at a time when you are unlikely to be using your PC.
You must always specify a value for the minute
Please enter a valid hour (between 0 and 23)
Please enter a valid minute (between 0 and 59)
The number of minutes past the hour
Automatic Media Refresh - No longer Active
[li]* denotes all possible values. [li]Multiple values can be specified using commas (1,5). [li]A range can be specified using a hyphen (1-5). [li]Both may be specified together (1-4,7).
There are no items that match your search
Please select a category from the list:
Please select a RSS feed from the list:
Please select a user from the list:
Update to the latest stable release
Update to the latest development build
You may schedule automatic refreshes of the SwissCenter database by right clicking on the Simese icon in the taskbar and selecting [i]Update Media Scheduler[/i].

If you are experiencing problems with the Swisscenter then please post a description of the problem you are having and any other relevant information (such as your operating system) to the [em]Help forum[/em] on the %s website. [p] All or some of the information shown below may be requested to help troubleshoot your problem.
SwissCenter was unable to perform the selected action - please check the support.log.
The selected action was successfully applied to the SwissMonitor service.
SwissMonitor configuration updated. The service must be restarted for changes to take effect.

The SwissMonitor service is a simple windows service that will watch your defined media locations for changes to files (including new files being added, or files being deleted) and inform SwissCenter so that your database can be updated appropriately. However, this does not remove the need to run a scheduled refresh completely as there are some circumstances where changes may not be captured.[p][b]Please Note:[/b] If you use UNC paths in your media locations (eg: "\\nas\movies") then you must use the Services Control Panel to modify the SwissMonitor service to run in your own user account.
The specified swisscenter.ini location does not exist

SwissMonitor requires database connection details to be able to determine your media locations. These details are obtained from your swisscenter.ini which should exist in [b]%AppData%\Simese\Data\Config\Swisscenter.ini[/b]. This location should only be specified if your swisscenter.ini is located elsewhere (ie. if you use Apache).

SwissMonitor requires the port used to notify SwissCenter. This is obtained from your Simese.ini which should exist in [b]%AppData%\Simese\Simese.ini[/b]. If it doesn't exist then a default port of [b]8080[/b] will be assumed, unless specified here.
There are currently no details available for this artist/album/track. Please contribute to the community by visiting TheAudioDB.com and adding the missing details.
Weekend line and station closures from Transport for London. Also traffic camera images from around London.

Themes are automatically downloaded for movies and TV series by the "themoviedb" and "TheTVDB" parsers when details are added for new media. Select a title from the dropdown then select a theme from the available thumbnails. To use a selected theme you must select a 'Use on ...' option. If multiple themes are selected for a title then they will be used at random on the selected pages.
There are %s channels available with the selected filters.
Select the media types that will be available when browsing channels. You should only select types that are known to be compatible with your media player.
Cannot update channels, last updated %s hours ago
You have not selected any media types

The %s website aims to be the biggest and most up to date archive of internet TV channels (channels freely available on the internet). We have channels from all over the world and the database is updated each day by our users.
The channel list is maintained and hosted by the author of TOMA - Internet TV. To conserve bandwidth it is not permitted to update this list more than once every 24 hours.

The tracks you selected have been added to the playlist.[p] To start playing the tracks in your playlist or to modify the playlist at any time, press the %s button on your remote control and then select the %s option.
Font to be used to display Track information on the "Now Playing" screen, if supported (and enabled). Enter a font file name with full path to the file, or leave blank to try to auto-detect a font.
Please enter a Priority and Expression

The details for a TV series are determined from the filename and path using regular expressions. The file is compared with the following expressions until a match is found. These expressions contain placeholders for programme {p}, series {s}, episode {e}, and title {t}. You must have at least one of these placeholders in each expression to extract details. If you require assistance with this then you should post in the forums.
Failed to match with any expressions
Enter a filename including path to test whether your current expressions will identify the correct details. eg. C:/Media/TV/Robot Chicken/Series 1/Robot Chicken.S01E01.The Deep End.avi
Matched %s. Found Programme: %s, Series: %s, Episode: %s, Title: %s
An unknown error occurred. Please post a bug report to the forums describing the actions you were performing at the time.
You should specify a default certificate that will be applied to each file within this media location that does not have a certificate explicitly assigned to it.
A daily check is made to the %s website to determine if a new version of the SwissCenter is available. If it is, then an icon will appear on the main menu to indicate this.
Update failed - please try again later
There are no updates available at this time
The selected URL's have been removed
Please enter a title for the URL
Please select the type of the URL
A Super User will have access to more options on the media player. Such priviledges include being able to delete media.
The selected users have been deleted
The selected user has been modified
Please enter the maximum certificate that this user may view
The default user cannot be deleted
That user already exists, please try another name
Please enter the [em]maximum[/em] certificate that this user should be allowed to view. Items that have a higher certificate than the one you specify here will [em]not[/em] be visible to this user.
Please enter a name for the user as it should appear on the SwissCenter.
You may optionally protect this user with a PIN number (which may be up to 10 digits long)
Name, PIN, Max Certificate Viewable, Super User
Your user has been successfully changed
Information on the current weather conditions (or 5 day forecast) is downloaded from %s on demand.
There are no cities that match your search for %s in the SwissCenter database.[p] Would you like to search %s for possible matches anyway? (enter the city name in full before searching)
%s does not provide forecast information for the city of %s at this time.
GNU Wget is a network utility to retrieve files using HTTP, HTTPS and FTP, the most widely-used Internet protocols. It works non-interactively, so it can work in the background.
Wget was not found at the specified location
Please specify the full path of the Wget executable. This is usually detected correctly but on some Linux based systems you may have to manually enter this.
When this option is enabled, SwissCenter will include the option to lookup information (such as artists and movies) on the Wikipedia site.
YouTube %s is a video sharing website on which users can upload and share videos.

All YouTube videos can be streamed at a standard resolution of (480x360). Selecting this option will stream a HD (1280x720) version if available. This should be disabled if you have bandwidth issues streaming HD content.
No user with the supplied username (%s) was found.
Each SwissCenter user can be associated with a YouTube username. If you do not enter a username then you will not have access to subscriptions, favourites, etc.
